title: Bug 90143[itds] Problem with an ITD on an interface
description: If an ITD method is declared on an interface with an anonymous inner classreturned as the result, the compiler generates an error for any "super.xxx"calls in the anonymous inner class.The example project shows this with anested inner interface, but the same problem occurs with an ITD of this kindon any interface.The error does not occur if the ITD is declared on an innerclass (as shown in the example) or a normal class.
